home.title: Minervia Institute - Excellence in Education
home.description: A distinguished Polish institution offering world-class education to students from around the globe.
home.heroTitle: Discover Your Potential at Minervia Institute
home.heroDescription: Founded in 1998, Minervia Institute has been nurturing academic excellence and fostering global perspectives in the heart of Poland.

1.title: Distinguished Faculty
1.description: Learn from over 200 professors and researchers with international recognition in their fields.

2.title: Global Community
2.description: Join a diverse student body representing more than 50 countries across 6 continents.

3.title: Modern Facilities
3.description: Study in our state-of-the-art campus featuring advanced laboratories and research centers.

4.title: Career Success
4.description: 92% of our graduates secure employment within 6 months of graduation.

accreditation.title: Accreditation & Recognition
accreditation.description: Minervia Institute is fully accredited by the Polish Accreditation Committee (PKA) and recognized by the Ministry of Science and Higher Education.
accreditation.ministry: Ministry of Science and Higher Education

about.title: About Minervia Institute
about.description: A legacy of academic excellence since 1998.
about.missionText: To provide accessible, high-quality education that prepares students for global challenges while fostering innovation, critical thinking, and ethical leadership.
about.visionText: To be recognized as a leading European institution for academic excellence, research innovation, and international collaboration.
about.valuesText: Excellence, Integrity, Diversity, Innovation, and Community.

history.title: Our History
history.description: From humble beginnings to international recognition

1998.title: Foundation
1998.description: Minervia Institute was established in Krakow by a group of visionary educators committed to creating an internationally-focused institution.

2003.title: First International Students
2003.description: Welcomed our first cohort of international students from 12 countries, marking the beginning of our global community.

2008.title: Research Center Opening
2008.description: Inaugurated the Advanced Research Center, expanding our capabilities in science and technology research.

2012.title: Erasmus+ Partnership
2012.description: Became a full partner in the Erasmus+ programme, enabling student and faculty exchanges across Europe.

2018.title: 20th Anniversary
2018.description: Celebrated two decades of excellence with the opening of our new modern campus facilities.

2024.title: Digital Innovation
2024.description: Launched comprehensive digital learning platforms and expanded online program offerings.

rector.name: Prof. Dr. Andrzej Kowalski
rector.title: Rector
rector.bio: Professor Kowalski has led Minervia Institute since 2019, bringing over 30 years of experience in higher education administration and research in applied mathematics.

viceRector.name: Prof. Dr. Maria Nowak
viceRector.title: Vice-Rector for Academic Affairs
viceRector.bio: Professor Nowak oversees academic programs and curriculum development, with expertise in educational innovation and quality assurance.

dean.name: Prof. Dr. Piotr Wisniewski
dean.title: Dean of Students
dean.bio: Professor Wisniewski is dedicated to student success and welfare, managing student services and campus life initiatives.

programs.title: Academic Programs
programs.description: Comprehensive undergraduate and graduate programs designed for the modern world.
programs.csDescription: Comprehensive program covering software engineering, artificial intelligence, data science, and cybersecurity.
programs.businessDescription: Develop leadership skills in management, finance, marketing, and international business.
programs.engineeringDescription: Hands-on training in mechanical, electrical, and civil engineering with modern laboratory facilities.
programs.medicineDescription: Six-year medical program with clinical rotations at partner hospitals across Poland.
programs.lawDescription: Comprehensive legal education with focus on European and international law.
programs.artsDescription: Explore literature, philosophy, history, and cultural studies in an international context.

admissions.title: Admissions
admissions.description: Begin your academic journey at Minervia Institute.
admissions.step1Desc: Contact our admissions office or authorized representative to receive your unique registration code.
admissions.step2Desc: Fill out the online application form with your personal and academic information.
admissions.step3Desc: Upload required documents including transcripts, identification, and language certificates.
admissions.step4Desc: Our admissions committee will review your application within 2-4 weeks.
admissions.step5Desc: You will be notified of the admission decision via email.

requirements.title: Admission Requirements
requirements.academicDesc: High school diploma or equivalent with minimum GPA of 3.0 (or equivalent).
requirements.languageDesc: English proficiency: IELTS 6.0, TOEFL 80, or equivalent. Polish programs require B2 Polish certificate.
requirements.documentsList: Passport copy, Academic transcripts, Language certificate, Motivation letter, CV/Resume

deadlines.title: Application Deadlines
deadlines.note: Late applications may be considered on a case-by-case basis.

tuition.title: Tuition & Fees
tuition.note: Scholarships and financial aid available for qualified students.

campus.title: Campus Life
campus.description: Experience vibrant student life in the heart of Krakow.

location.title: Location
location.description: Our campus is located in Krakow, one of Europe's most beautiful and historic cities, offering a perfect blend of academic excellence and cultural richness.

library.title: University Library
library.description: Over 500,000 volumes, digital resources, and 24/7 study spaces.

labs.title: Research Laboratories
labs.description: State-of-the-art facilities for science, engineering, and medical research.

sports.title: Sports Complex
sports.description: Gymnasium, swimming pool, tennis courts, and fitness center.

dining.title: Dining Services
dining.description: Multiple cafeterias and restaurants offering diverse cuisine options.

housing.title: Student Housing
housing.description: Modern dormitories with single and shared room options, located within walking distance of academic buildings.
housing.features: High-speed internet, Study rooms, Laundry facilities, 24/7 security

organizations.title: Student Organizations
organizations.description: Join over 50 student clubs and organizations covering academic, cultural, sports, and social interests.

international.title: International Office
international.description: Visa assistance, orientation programs, and support for international students.

career.title: Career Services
career.description: Job placement, internship coordination, and career counseling.

counseling.title: Counseling Center
counseling.description: Mental health support, academic advising, and personal counseling.

health.title: Health Center
health.description: On-campus medical clinic with general practitioners and specialists.

orientation.title: Orientation Week
orientation.description: Welcome activities, campus tours, and introduction to university life.

international.title: International Week
international.description: Cultural performances, food festivals, and academic presentations.

career.title: Career Fair
career.description: Meet employers, explore internships, and network with industry professionals.

graduation.title: Graduation Ceremony
graduation.description: Celebrate academic achievements with family and friends.

safety.title: Safety & Security
safety.description: Your safety is our priority. Our campus features comprehensive security measures.

tour.title: Visit Our Campus
tour.description: Experience Minervia Institute firsthand. Schedule a campus tour or attend an open day event.

news.title: News & Events
news.description: Stay updated with the latest happenings at Minervia Institute.

1.title: Spring Semester Registration Now Open
1.summary: Registration for the Spring 2026 semester is now open. Early registration deadline is February 15.

2.title: Research Grant Awarded to Engineering Department
2.summary: The Engineering Department has received a 2 million EUR grant for renewable energy research.

3.title: International Week Celebration
3.summary: Join us for International Week featuring cultural performances, food festivals, and academic presentations.

4.title: New Partnership with Tech Industry Leaders
4.summary: Minervia Institute announces new internship partnerships with leading technology companies.

calendar.title: Academic Calendar
calendar.description: Important dates for the academic year 2025-2026.

faq.title: Frequently Asked Questions
faq.description: Find answers to common questions about Minervia Institute.

1.question: What are the admission requirements?
1.answer: Admission requirements include a high school diploma (or equivalent), language proficiency certificate, and completed application form. Specific programs may have additional requirements.

2.question: Is the instruction in English or Polish?
2.answer: We offer programs in both English and Polish. Most international programs are conducted entirely in English. Check individual program pages for language details.

3.question: What scholarships are available?
3.answer: We offer merit-based scholarships, need-based financial aid, and special scholarships for international students. Contact our financial aid office for details.

4.question: Is on-campus housing available?
4.answer: Yes, we have modern dormitories with single and shared room options. Housing applications should be submitted along with your admission application.

5.question: Can I work while studying?
5.answer: International students can work up to 20 hours per week during the semester. The Career Services office can help you find part-time opportunities.

6.question: What is the student-to-faculty ratio?
6.answer: Our student-to-faculty ratio is approximately 15:1, ensuring personalized attention and mentorship opportunities.

7.question: Are there exchange programs available?
7.answer: Yes, as an Erasmus+ partner, we offer exchange opportunities with over 100 universities across Europe and beyond.

8.question: How do I apply for a student visa?
8.answer: After receiving your acceptance letter, our International Office will provide guidance and documentation for your visa application.

contact.title: Still have questions?
contact.description: Contact our admissions team for personalized assistance.
